title: Letters: Brexit negotiators on both sides have backed themselves into a corner
text:
SIR – If the EU won’t make a decision on a Brexit extension until Britain makes a decision on a general election, and Britain won’t make a decision on a general election until the EU makes a decision on an extension, then Brexit is up a cul-de-sac.

Moira Merryweather

Worthen, Shropshire

SIR – The greatest threat to Britain’s leaving the EU is now Nigel Farage’s Brexit Party. If its opposition to the Prime Minister’s deal is maintained during a general election campaign, the Brexiteer vote will be split.

Against the divided Brexiteers will be Labour, the Liberal Democrats, the Green Party and the Scottish National Party, plus possibly the Democratic Unionist Party. It would be no surprise if...
description: SIR – If the EU won’t make a decision on a Brexit extension until Britain makes a decision on a general election, and Britain won’t make a decision on a general election until the EU makes a decision on an extension, then Brexit is up a cul-de-sac.
